meanings.sent1: The cactus was pricky to the touch.
meanings.sent2: The hedgehog's back was pricky with spines.
meanings.sent3: The pricky bush didn't want to be hugged.
meanings.sent4: His words were like pricky thorns, causing pain.
meanings.sent5: The pricky surface warned of danger ahead.

meanings.sent1: She had a pricky attitude all day.
meanings.sent2: He became pricky when his plans were disrupted.
meanings.sent3: The pricky cat refused to be petted.
meanings.sent4: The pricky customer complained about everything.
meanings.sent5: Her pricky tone made everyone uncomfortable.

meanings.sent1: The pricky thorn pricked his finger.
meanings.sent2: The pricky tip of the pencil broke off.
meanings.sent3: The pricky edge of the paper cut his skin.
meanings.sent4: The pricky rock jutted out from the ground.
meanings.sent5: The pricky needle gleamed in the sunlight.
